alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 6:44AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG NORTHEAST WINDS AND BLOWING SNOW THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON IN THE MATANUSKA VALLEY... Northeast winds sustained 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph will continue across the Matanuska Valley through Thursday afternoon before slowly diminishing Thursday evening. Areas of blowing and drifting snow will accompany these strong wind gusts, with significant drifting along area roadways likely. Blowing snow may reduce visibility to as low as one mile at times. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution when travelling through areas of blowing and drifting snow. The strongest wind gusts are expected around the Palmer area with gusts to 50 mph possible farther west, including Wasilla.
